name: Channel complexity for exchange
functionStatement: Surface water-groundwater exchange moderates temperature, transforms nutrients, supplies oxygen, and supports aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Diverse bedforms enhance surface-subsurface exchange, matching reference morphology.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count riffle-pool or other bedform features per 100 m using imagery and a field check.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Featureless, planar bed with silt cover.
Criteria: Bed lacks form. Exchange likely negligible.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mostly long runs. Few weak riffles.
Criteria: Mostly uniform habitat with limited exchange features.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some riffles and shallow pools but long uniform runs between.
Criteria: Bedform variety present but partially uniform.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Alternating riffle-pool sequence. Distinct head drops at riffles. Patchy dunes in sand-bed reaches.
Criteria: Well-developed bedforms with obvious upwelling and downwelling zones.

references: High-resolution imagery and LiDAR hillshade (where available)
